intro: Tibouchina ursina, commonly known as the waxleaf tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces showy clusters of pink or purple flowers during the spring and summer months. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms. Tibouchina ursina prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for tropical and subtropical climates.
